conclusion: Use Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction to determine induced current.
Given parameters: side length \( l \), width of magnetic field \( d \), speed \( v \), condition \( l < d \).
Frame starts to experience induced current at \( t = 0 \) when entering the magnetic field.
Time taken to fully enter the magnetic field is \( t_1 = \frac{l}{v} \).
Total time to completely cross the magnetic field is \( t_2 = \frac{d}{v} \).
Time taken to fully exit the magnetic field is \( t_3 = \frac{d - l}{v} \).
Total time of induction is \( t = \frac{d}{v} \).
Final answer: Time during which there is an induced current is \( \frac{d}{v} \).
